actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that in qualifying as a Foreign Sales Corporation (FSC), the business entity will be required to be created or organized under the laws applicable to any possession of the United States and to maintain an office in any possession of the United States, as defined in Subpart C of Part III of such subchapter N of chapter 1 thereof.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide that, in qualifying as a Foreign Sales Corporation, a business entity will be required to be created or organized under the laws applicable to any possession of the United States and to maintain an office located outside the United States in any possession of the United States.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that in qualifying as a Foreign Sales Corporation (FSC), the business entity will be required to be created or organized under the laws applicable to any possession of the United States and to maintain an office in any possession of the United States, as defined in Subpart C of Part III of such subchapter N of chapter 1 thereof.
